intro: Ouratea tumacoensis, commonly known as the Tumaco ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its ornamental, palm-like appearance with smooth, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
